title: In-Depth Understanding of Computer Viruses Through Virtual World Simulations

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced studies and experience in executing high-level projects
context.additional_context: Applies a blended pedagogy combining virtual world simulations and role-playing activities in smartphone-centric, technology-constrained settings, emphasizing mathematical modeling to analyze virus transmission mechanisms.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the propagation principles of computer viruses through mathematical models (infection rate equations, network graph theory)
Learners can quantitatively predict infection spread pathways by analyzing observed virus cases in virtual world simulations
Learners can design computer virus defense mechanisms using probabilistic approaches (e.g., patch application probability calculations)

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
